job.title: Digital Asset Coordinator
job.description: <p><strong><u>Digital Asset Coordinator / Vault</u></strong></p><p><strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Manage all Digital Assets on our Production servers and Physical Tape/Drive Assets in our vault.</li><li>Correspond with our internal post-supervisors about all incoming and outgoing digital assets, drives, or tapes.</li><li>Make sure all digital and physical assets are received and delivered securely according to our security procedures and policies.</li><li>Log the metadata of all incoming and outgoing digital files into our Digital Asset Management System.</li><li>Keep accurate and up-to-date logs of LTO Tape Archives.</li><li>Setup redundant or old unneeded assets for recycling or destruction.</li><li>Make sure vault is organized and physical asset inventory lists are current.</li><li>Correspond with outside clients about the deliveries of drives and Digital transfers (Aspera).</li><li>Some administrative duties may be required like filing documents, copying, archiving, and setting up deliveries.</li><li>Physical labor may be required with our physical assets in the vault. (up to 25 lbs)</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Must have 2 - 4 years of experience working in A/V post-production environment.</li><li>Working Knowledge of Xytech or Digital Asset Management Software.</li><li>Knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook, and FileMaker Pro.</li><li>Experience working with many different types of data and video files.</li><li>Ability to multi-task in a high pressure, fast-paced post-production environment.</li><li>Must have a professional attitude and the ability to work cooperatively with co-workers.</li><li>Strong organization and communication skills with attention to detail.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits program including medical, dental &amp; vision coverage, vacation &amp; sick leave, 401(k), and more.</p>
